name: Whimsy Warehouse 32
ideas: Host a formal intervention for your plant about its dramatic wilting every time you're two hours late with water. Tears may be involved.
Create a behind-the-scenes documentary about the office politics between your kitchen appliances. The microwave and toaster have beef.
Write acceptance speeches for awards you'll never win, then practice your surprised face in the mirror until it's Oscar-worthy.
Develop a complex heist movie plot for stealing the last cookie from the jar. Ocean's Eleven but with more crumbs.
Create a nature documentary about the migratory patterns of your loose change. Where do they go? The couch knows.
Host a court trial where you prosecute your alarm clock for crimes against your peace. Witness testimony from your pillow.
Write a strongly-worded treaty between your left foot and right foot about who leads when walking. Mediation may be required.
Develop a wildlife rescue operation for the chips that fell between couch cushions. Some have been there since 2019.
Create a TED Talk about why your shower thoughts are scientifically superior to your regular thoughts. Cite fictional studies.
Host a retirement party for a pen that finally ran out of ink. Speech, cake, the whole deal. It served with honor.
Write a Shakespearean tragedy about the sock that went into the dryer but never came out. To be paired, or not to be paired.
Develop an elaborate origin story for the stain on your favorite shirt. Every superhero has a beginning.
Create a medieval fantasy saga where dust bunnies under your bed form rival kingdoms and wage tiny wars.
Host a press conference announcing your decision to finally throw away that chair you never sit in. Field tough questions.
Write a manifesto from the perspective of your unread emails demanding to be acknowledged. The inbox uprising begins.
Develop a sports commentary for your attempt to catch a falling object before it hits the ground. Slow motion replays included.
Create a dating profile for your lonely houseplant. Looking for: sunlight, occasional water, someone who won't forget I exist.
Host a summit between your Monday self and Friday self to negotiate weekend terms. Coffee is a required mediator.
Write a formal letter of resignation from being an adult and submit it to absolutely no one who will accept it.
Develop a true crime podcast investigating who finished the milk and put the empty carton back. The betrayal runs deep.
Create a job listing for the position of 'Thing You Bought But Never Used.' Many qualified candidates are applying.
Host an intervention for your browsing history about its concerning late-night rabbit holes. Wikipedia binges aren't healthy.
Write a diplomatic cable from your stomach to your brain explaining that 2 AM cheese is non-negotiable.
Develop a training montage soundtrack for the epic task of getting out of bed. Rocky, but horizontal.
Create a formal awards ceremony for your most reliable bodily function. Acceptance speech from your lungs: 'I couldn't have done it without oxygen.'
Host a séance to contact the ghost of your motivation. Last seen: January 2nd of any given year.
Write a travel guide to all the rooms in your house from the perspective of a very impressed ant.
Develop a soap opera about the romantic entanglements happening in your utensil drawer. Spoons and forks: forbidden love.
Create a scientific research paper on the phenomenon of fridges becoming more interesting when you're bored. Peer review welcome.
Host a roast for your most embarrassing memory that keeps you up at night. Finally, closure through comedy.
Write a formal acquisition proposal where Netflix attempts to merge with your weekend plans. Antitrust concerns raised.
Develop a constitutional amendment protecting your right to take weirdly long showers while having imaginary debates.
Create a passport for your favorite mug documenting its travels from cupboard to desk to sink. Well-traveled vessel.
Host a focus group testing new names for that weird sound your house makes at 3 AM. Current frontrunner: Gerald.
Write a product recall notice for your decision-making skills when shopping while hungry. Defective units everywhere.
Develop an elaborate negotiation between your desire to exercise and your couch's gravitational pull. Couch is winning.
Create a historical documentary about the Great Tupperware Lid Diaspora and the containers it left behind.
Host a championship wrestling match between your need for sleep and your need to scroll for 'just five more minutes.'
Write a formal noise complaint to your neighbor's thoughts about you that are definitely not real. Paranoia has standards.
Develop a complex mythology explaining why there's always one drawer in every house that's just... full of stuff.
Create a breaking news broadcast about the shocking revelation that you've been pronouncing a common word wrong your whole life.
Host a graduation ceremony for the food that's been in your fridge long enough to develop a personality.
Write a diplomatic immunity request for your procrastination. It's not avoidance, it's strategic delay.
Develop a nature documentary about your eyebrows and their complex emotional communication system.
Create a formal border dispute resolution between where your desk ends and chaos begins. Clear lines required.
Host an awards show for the most dramatic sighs you've ever produced. Categories include: Existential, Frustrated, and Theatrical.
Write a letter of recommendation for yourself from the perspective of the last snack you ate. Glowing reviews only.
Develop an elaborate fantasy world where lost hair ties form their own society in the dimension behind your dresser.
Create a podcast interview with the version of yourself that exists only in your hypothetical arguments in the shower.
Host an emotional support group for all the tabs you've kept open for weeks with the intention of 'reading later.'
Establish a formal witness protection program for the ice cubes that saw too much when you opened the freezer at 3 AM.
Create a nature documentary about the migratory patterns of your phone charger cable, which somehow ends up in a different room every day.
Host a town hall meeting for all the apps on your phone to discuss why they each believe they deserve notification privileges.
Write a strongly worded letter to past-you about the browser bookmarks they saved that present-you will never, ever visit.
Develop a courtroom drama where you prosecute the fitted sheet for its crimes against humanity during laundry folding.
Create a motivational speaking tour for the vegetables slowly wilting in your crisper drawer. They had dreams once.
Host an intervention for the pen that writes perfectly on scrap paper but refuses to work on anything important.
Write a nature documentary about the complex social hierarchy of the mugs in your cabinet. Some haven't been chosen in years.
Develop a diplomatic summit between your left and right earbuds to negotiate why only one of them still works.
Create an archaeological expedition to explore the ancient civilization at the bottom of your bag, including artifact analysis of receipts from 2019.
Host a memorial service for all the sneezes that felt like they were coming but ultimately betrayed you.
Write a formal treaty between your bed and your alarm clock to establish acceptable snooze button boundaries.
Develop a game show where your spices compete to prove they haven't expired. Most of them will lose.
Create a therapy session for the coat hanger that's been holding the same jacket since before the pandemic.
Host an employee orientation for the new roll of toilet paper, explaining the legacy and expectations of its predecessor.
Write a formal complaint to the international committee about the spoon that's always in the sink no matter how many times you wash it.
Develop an origin story for the mysterious stain on your ceiling that you've been pretending not to notice for three years.
Create a podcast where you interview various household items about whether they feel used or appreciated. Start with the doormat.
Host a reality dating show for single socks seeking their perfect match. The washing machine is the villain.
Write acceptance speeches for the daily awards you should receive, including 'Successfully Left the House' and 'Wore Pants Voluntarily.'
Develop an elaborate heist movie plot where you steal back time from every meeting that should have been an email.
Create a rescue mission briefing for the Chapstick lost behind your nightstand. It's been twelve months. We're going in.
Host a jury trial for the leftovers that promised they'd be eaten tomorrow but have been in the fridge for a week.
Write a fantasy novel about the brave dust bunny that journeyed from under your bed to see what lies beyond the hallway.
Develop a sports commentary for the race between which will run out first: your phone battery or your will to socialize.
Create a documentary about the cold war between your morning self who sets multiple alarms and your future self who disables them all.
Host a press conference where your stomach announces its official position on the dinner you're considering.
Write a scientific paper theorizing about what happens in the microwave during the last five seconds when everything goes wrong.
Develop an awards ceremony for the best background extras in your life: the person you've nodded at for years but never spoken to.
Create a formal apology from your brain to your mouth for all the times it shipped the wrong words to your lips.
Host a debate tournament between every version of an excuse you've rehearsed before canceling plans.
Write a survival guide for navigating the hostile environment of walking into a room and forgetting why you're there.
Develop a true crime podcast investigating the mysterious case of where all your hair ties go when they're not on your wrist.
Create a resignation letter from your last remaining brain cell after you watched the same video seventeen times.
Host a peace treaty signing between your face and the corner of the door frame that keeps attacking you.
Write a coming-of-age story about the tea bag that finally found the courage to leave the mug after steeping for forty minutes.
Develop a formal complaint about the betrayal of pants that fit perfectly in the store but have apparently shrunk in your closet.
Create a motivational poster series featuring the spam emails that really believed you wanted to claim your Nigerian inheritance.
Host a reunion special for all the conversations you ended with 'we should hang out soon' and never followed up on.
Write a formal partnership agreement between your eyes and the refrigerator during the midnight staring contest for snack ideas.
Develop a breaking news segment about the ongoing hostage situation where your headphone wires have taken your keys captive in your pocket.
Create an emotional goodbye video for the YouTube rabbit hole you're about to fall into. See you in four hours.
Host a performance review for your brain's search engine, which keeps delivering random embarrassing memories from 2007 instead of useful information.
Write a neighborhood watch report about the suspicious activity of your chair slowly rolling away from your desk while you work.
Develop a nature documentary about the feeding habits of your wallet when presented with things you absolutely do not need.
Create a formal inauguration ceremony for the new roll of paper towels assuming its position of responsibility.
Host a speed dating event for all the tasks on your to-do list competing for your attention. Spoiler: Netflix wins.
Write a travel guide for the journey between your bed and the bathroom at 3 AM, including hazard warnings for furniture corners.
Develop a soap opera about the dramatic love triangle between you, your bed, and your responsibilities.
Create an exit interview for the motivation that left your body the moment you sat down after getting home from work.
Conduct a hostile takeover of your sock drawer and install yourself as CEO. Quarterly earnings are disappointing.
Write a letter of recommendation for the pen that has been with you since it mysteriously appeared and you have no memory of acquiring.
Host an intervention for the houseplant that has clearly given up on life despite your aggressive encouragement.
Create a formal extradition request for the popcorn kernel stuck in your teeth that refuses to surrender peacefully.
Develop a witness protection program for the last cookie that knows too much about your midnight snacking habits.
Write a cease and desist letter to your alarm clock for its daily acts of terrorism against your peace.
Conduct a séance to communicate with the pizza you ate last week. Ask if it has any regrets.
Create a hostile work environment complaint filed by your left shoe against your right shoe for constantly getting more attention.
Develop a true crime podcast investigating the cold case of who ate the leftovers you were saving.
Host a diplomatic summit between your couch cushions to negotiate the return of all swallowed remote controls and loose change.
Write a manifesto from the perspective of the shower thought that was definitely genius but evaporated before you could write it down.
Create a wildlife rescue operation for the ice cube that fell behind the fridge and has been living feral for months.
Develop a formal impeachment process for the autocorrect feature that has committed crimes against your dignity.
Host a veterans' reunion for all the pens you borrowed and never returned. Award purple hearts.
Write a ransom note demanding better dreams from your subconscious. The hostage is your good mood tomorrow.
Create a courtroom drama where you prosecute your past self for crimes against your current schedule.
Develop a union negotiation between your taste buds and your stomach regarding portion control policies.
Host a press conference addressing rumors that you've been wearing the same hoodie for a week. No comment.
Write a peace treaty between your ambition to exercise and your couch's gravitational field.
Create a formal noise complaint against your stomach for its inappropriate commentary during quiet meetings.
Develop a morning talk show hosted by the dust bunnies under your bed discussing current events in the undercouch district.
Host an awards ceremony for the browser tab that has been open so long you're afraid to close it in case it's important.
Write a memoir from the perspective of the grocery list you forgot at home while standing in the store.
Create a sports commentary for the epic battle between your fitted sheet and basic folding competency.
Develop a documentary about the great migration of crumbs from the counter to the floor and their eventual extinction by broom.
Host a job fair for your idle brain cells currently unemployed during important meetings.
Write a strongly worded letter to gravity for its role in your phone's screen-first descent to the floor.
Create a reality competition where your responsibilities compete in challenges. Immunity goes to the one you keep postponing.
Develop a support group for people who have rehearsed the perfect comeback three days after the conversation ended.
Host a naturalization ceremony for the random coin that has been living in your pocket for six months and is now a legal resident.
Write fan fiction about the alternate universe where you remembered to take the chicken out to defrost.
Create a formal investigation into why the other lane always moves faster the moment you switch lanes.
Develop a Nobel Prize ceremony for the brave souls who test if the milk has gone bad by smelling it directly.
Host a philosophical debate between your 'treat yourself' impulse and your bank account balance.
Write a declaration of independence from your phone's low battery anxiety that controls your life.
Create a custody battle for the aux cord between passengers who have very different taste in music.
Develop a conspiracy documentary about the printer that works perfectly until you actually need to print something.
Host a graduation ceremony for the food in your fridge that has finally completed its transformation into a science experiment.
Write a breaking news alert about the discovery of ancient civilizations under your bed, carbon dated to last spring cleaning.
Create a formal apology from your brain to your mouth for that thing you said in 2015 that you still think about.
Develop a nature documentary about the nocturnal hunting patterns of your refrigerator when you're trying to be quiet at 2 AM.
Host a town hall meeting for the various tissues crumpled in your pockets to discuss their future.
Write a safety briefing for your houseguests about the temperamental light switch that requires a secret jiggle technique.
Create an archaeological dig of your purse or backpack and catalog the artifacts by era and emotional significance.
Develop a shareholders meeting for the company formed by all the streaming services you pay for but rarely use.
Host a memorial service for your attention span, which was last seen alive in 2010 before smartphones.
Write a parole hearing for the jeans you bought optimistically that have served five years in the back of the closet.
Create a formal alliance between your eyebrows to finally agree on a consistent shape after years of civil war.
Develop a keynote presentation on the technological marvel of your grandparents' TV remote, which has 47 buttons for 3 functions.
Host a tribunal for the shopping cart wheel that commits acts of chaos while the other three wheels watch in complicity.
Establish a witness protection program for the ice cubes that saw what you did to that leftover pizza at 2 AM.
Write a strongly-worded letter to gravity demanding compensation for all the things you've dropped over the years.
Create a dating profile for your houseplant and swipe on behalf of it. Your fern deserves love too.
Develop an awards show for the most dramatic text message you've ever drafted but never sent. The nominees are devastating.
Host a congressional hearing investigating why your charger only works at that one specific angle.
Write a nature documentary about the slow, desperate migration of your phone battery from 15% to 1%.
Create a formal peace treaty between your left and right earbuds after years of tangling disputes.
Develop a true crime podcast investigating who keeps moving your stuff to places you definitely didn't put it.
Host a retirement party for the pen that finally ran out of ink after years of faithful service and several kidnappings.
Write a dramatic courtroom scene where you sue your past self for making plans current you has to keep.
Create an employee onboarding manual for new thoughts entering your brain at 3 AM.
Develop a nature documentary about the aggressive mating dance between your blanket and your feet at night.
Host a diplomatic summit between your calendar and your ambitions to discuss realistic expectations.
Write a survival guide for navigating the treacherous terrain of stepping on LEGO bricks in the dark.
Create a formal job posting for a replacement brain cell after the last one quit during that conversation.
Develop an archaeological theory about the ancient civilization that left those crumbs in your keyboard.
Host an intervention for your shopping cart's habit of adding things you definitely don't need.
Write a weather report for the climate inside your blanket fort. Conditions are cozy with a chance of snacks.
Create a UN resolution demanding the immediate return of all the Tupperware lids that have fled to another dimension.
Develop a reality show where your different sleep positions compete for dominance each night.
Host a press conference announcing the discovery of that thing you lost three years ago in a jacket pocket.
Write an epic ballad about the brave dish sponge that gave its life battling the burnt casserole.
Create a formal complaint to the moon about its inconsistent scheduling affecting your sleep patterns.
Develop a tenant agreement between your brain and intrusive thoughts outlining visiting hours.
Host a championship tournament between all the different ways you've spelled 'restaurant' over the years.
Write a heroic origin story for the one brave grocery bag that held all your items when the others would have torn.
Create a nature documentary about the predator-prey relationship between your snooze button and your alarm.
Develop a formal custody arrangement for the shared Netflix account password after the friend group splits.
Host an awards ceremony for the most creative excuses your autocorrect has generated.
Write a diplomatic memo from your stomach to your brain requesting they coordinate on hunger signals.
Create a breaking news bulletin about the escalating tensions between your fitted sheet and your mattress corners.
Develop a fantasy map of your junk drawer complete with regions, kingdoms, and mysterious unexplored territories.
Host a reunion special for all the browser tabs you've had open for so long you forgot why.
Write a formal resignation letter from your New Year's resolution, effective immediately.
Create a nature documentary about the mysterious migration patterns of your car keys throughout the house.
Develop a hostage negotiation training scenario where you bargain with yourself to get out of bed.
Host a tribunal for the one sock that convinced its partner to escape during the laundry cycle.
Write an investigative report on the shadow economy of the coins that fall between your couch cushions.
Create a formal performance improvement plan for the wifi router that keeps forgetting how to do its one job.
Develop a reality TV elimination round where you finally decide which of your seventeen water bottles to keep.
Host a truth and reconciliation commission between you and the group chat you've been ignoring.
Write a nature documentary about the territorial disputes between different piles of clean laundry on your chair.
Create a formal declaration of independence from your comfort zone, complete with revolutionary war reenactment.
Develop a conspiracy theory about the shadow organization that decides which songs will get stuck in your head.
Host a job fair for all the skills you listed on your resume but don't actually have.
Write an origin myth explaining how the first crumb fell behind the stove and became immortal.
Create a formal alliance proposal between coffee and your bloodstream, with terms of mutual support.
Develop a competitive league for the speed at which you close your eyes when someone unexpectedly takes a photo.
Host an intervention for your brain's addiction to imagining arguments you'll never have.
Write a documentary about the noble sacrifice of the first chip that breaks off to test if the salsa is too spicy.
